meanings.definition: Mutual trust and friendship among people who spend a lot of time together.
meanings.sent1: The team's camaraderie was evident during their celebratory dinner.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers' camaraderie helped them overcome challenges together.
meanings.sent3: The camaraderie among the classmates made studying for exams more enjoyable.
meanings.sent4: The camaraderie in the office was like a warm blanket on a cold day.
meanings.sent5: The campers' camaraderie around the bonfire created a sense of unity.

meanings.definition: A spirit of good friendship and loyalty among members of a group.
meanings.sent1: The camaraderie among the siblings was heartwarming to witness.
meanings.sent2: The sports team's camaraderie was key to their success on the field.
meanings.sent3: The camaraderie between the actors backstage added to the excitement of the play.
meanings.sent4: The camaraderie of the book club members was like a treasure chest of shared stories.
meanings.sent5: The firefighters' camaraderie was a beacon of support during tough times.
